intro: Galium hexanarium, commonly known as the six-angled bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are white or pale pink, clustered in small umbels, and it produces small, three-lobed berries. Galium hexanarium thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
